content.hero_title: URL Slug Generator - Create SEO-Friendly URLs
content.hero_subtitle: Generate clean, SEO-friendly URL slugs from any text instantly with our free slug generator tool. Convert blog titles, article headings, and page names into readable, search-engine-optimized URLs.
content.what_desc: A URL slug is the part of a web address that comes after the domain name and identifies a specific page. For example, in "example.com/how-to-create-seo-friendly-urls", the slug is "how-to-create-seo-friendly-urls".
why_list: Better SEO Rankings: Keywords in URLs help search engines understand page content
Improved Click-Through Rates: Readable URLs are more trustworthy and clickable
User Experience: Clear URLs tell users what to expect before clicking
Social Sharing: Clean URLs look professional when shared on social media
Link Building: Descriptive URLs make better anchor text for backlinks
Accessibility: Screen readers can better interpret meaningful URLs
practices_list: Use lowercase letters - Avoid capitalization for consistency
Use hyphens (-) - Separate words with hyphens, not underscores
Keep it short - Aim for 3-5 words maximum
Include keywords - Use relevant keywords for SEO
Be descriptive - Clearly describe the page content
Avoid stop words - Remove "a", "the", "and" when possible
Avoid numbers/dates - Unless essential for content
content.how_works_desc: Our tool follows industry best practices to create perfect URL slugs. It converts text to lowercase, removes special characters and punctuation, replaces spaces with hyphens, removes consecutive hyphens, and trims leading/trailing hyphens.

content.pro_tip_desc: Google recommends using hyphens (-) instead of underscores (_) in URLs because hyphens are treated as word separators while underscores are not. This means "seo-friendly-urls" is better than "seo_friendly_urls" for search engine optimization.

faq.q1: Should I use hyphens or underscores in URLs?
faq.a1: Always use hyphens (-). Google treats hyphens as word separators but treats underscores as word connectors. This means "best-seo-practices" is read as three separate words, while "best_seo_practices" is read as one word.
faq.q2: How long should a URL slug be?
faq.a2: Keep slugs between 3-5 words (30-60 characters). Shorter URLs are easier to remember, share, and rank better in search results. Remove unnecessary words like "a", "the", "and" to keep slugs concise.
faq.q3: Can I change a URL slug after publishing?
faq.a3: Yes, but it's not recommended. Changing URLs can break existing links and hurt SEO. If you must change a slug, always set up a 301 redirect from the old URL to the new one to preserve link equity and avoid 404 errors.
faq.q4: Should I include keywords in my URL slug?
faq.a4: Yes! Including relevant keywords in your URL slug helps search engines understand your content and can improve rankings. However, keep it natural and descriptive - don't stuff keywords unnaturally.
